intro: Fimbristylis pachystylis, commonly known as the broad-styled sedge, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, triangular leaves and dense clusters of small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in wetland or swampy habitats, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Fimbristylis pachystylis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
